III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12206
Section Staff qualifications; volunteer, contractors on central registry
Description • (2) A staff member must be of responsible character and
suitable and able to meet the needs of children and families
served by the agency.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation It is alleged that a staff member is selling marijuana to ILP youth.
Investigation This investigation was conducted jointly with DHHS Worker. The
investigation was initiated on 6/02/2025. Interviews were
conducted onsite with the exception of one conducted by
telephone.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face on 6/10/2025. Staff 1
reported he has worked for the agency for 2 years in the Harrison
ILP (Independent Living Placement) home on campus. Staff 1 was
informed of the allegation. Staff 1 denied he has ever given
marijuana to Youth A. Staff 1 reported Youth A did not like him as
he had written Youth A up on several occasions when he was
found to be smoking marijuana on the patio of the home. Staff 1
further denied that he had ever given or attempted to sell
marijuana to any ILP youth. Staff 1 reported Youth A would use
racial slurs when he wrote up incident reports regarding Youth A’s
marijuana use at the home. Staff 1 reported he felt Youth A
claiming that he had given him marijuana was a “get back” for
writing him up. Staff 1 reported that allegation occurred after
Youth A had been discharged from the program. Staff 1 was
asked if he had ever received disciplinary action while working for
the agency and he replied that he had never been written up.
Youth B was interviewed face to face on 6/10/2025. Youth B
reported that he is 17 years old. Youth B reported he has been a
resident of Harrison House for 6-7 months. Youth B reported
Youth A had told him that Staff 1 had sold him some weed. Youth
B then stated, “That’s bullshit”, referring to the allegation that Staff
1 had tried to sell marijuana to Youth A. Youth B reported Youth A
was mad at Staff 1 as Staff 1 had written him up for smoking weed
at the home. Youth B stated Staff 1 is a “good staff”. Youth B
reported he had never smelled marijuana on Staff 1 or any other
staff.
2

Youth C was interviewed face to face on 6/10/2025. Youth C
reported he resides in Harrison House and is 17 years old. Youth
C reported Staff 1 had never tried to sell or give him marijuana.
Youth C denied he had seen Staff 1 try to sell or give marijuana to
Youth A. Youth C stated Staff 1 is a “good guy”.
Youth D was interviewed face to face on 6/10/2025. Youth D is
18 years old and resides in Harrison House. Youth D reported he
likes Staff 1 and he is like a parent to him. Youth D denied Staff 1
had ever tried to sell or give him marijuana. Youth D denied he
had seen Staff 1 give or sell marijuana to Youth A. Youth D
reported he has never smelled marijuana on any of the staff.
Youth A was interviewed via telephone on 6/30/2025. Youth A
reported he is 18 years old and he had resided in Harrison House
when he was placed at the agency. Youth A reported he left the
program and is now working and living independently. Youth A
reported he resided at the program for two months. Youth A
reported Staff 1 never tried to give or sell him marijuana. Youth A
reported that youth of the house would get their own marijuana
when they were out in the community. Youth A further reported no
staff at the program tried to sell him marijuana.
Director was interviewed via email on 6/23/225 and 7/01/2025.
The Director provided documents and on 7/01/2025 through email
correspondence she verified that Staff 1 has not received any
agency disciplinary action.
On 6/03/2025 Complainant was emailed requesting a phone
interview. The Complainant did not respond to the request.
DOCUMENT REVIEW:
Five agency incident reports involving Youth A were reviewed.
The incident reports document incidents related to AWOL,
aggression, and destructive behavior.
Analysis Staff 1 denies selling or giving marijuana to Youth A or any of the
other residents. Youth A denied that Staff 1 had tried to sell him
marijuana. Youth B, Youth C, and Youth D each denied that Staff
1 had tried to sell or give them marijuana. Director reported Staff 1
has not had any disciplinary action against him. There is
insufficient evidence that Staff 1 tried to sell Youth A marijuana.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
3

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
